content.question: Molten (liquid) <math alttext="N a C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the particulate diagram shown above. Which of the following indicates whether <math alttext="N a C l, liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> conducts electricity and best explains why or why not?

choices.label: It conducts electricity because <math alttext="N a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a metal.
It conducts electricity because ions are free to move.
It does not conduct electricity because <math alttext="C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a nonmetal.
It does not conduct electricity because there are no free electrons.

content.answer: It conducts electricity because ions are free to move.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
